Text.Value: What ails you - marsh fever? Featherlung? Be quick - I've not got all day.

EditorData.NodeContext: brusque, rude, to cover a bit of sadness

Text.Value: A bad case of scale chafe.
Do I look diseased to you?
Leave.
I heard about Father Lorgan. I'm sorry.
I'm sorry, too. Sorry we ever let these heretics into our midst.
I'm not sad. I'm angry. He dedicated his life to the needy - it shouldn't have ended like this.
Please, leave me be. I've got an awful lot to get done.
Father Lorgan is it?
I reckon Investigator Valeria is right.
Aye, I can smell that.
Who do you think killed him?
All the human ale's been making me gassy. Too many bubbles.
We give them everything, and all we get is nothing but a good man to bury.
You'd interrupt me for something like that? Just rub a bit of aloe on.
Father Lorgan. You've not heard?
About that - I have some questions.
They cut off his hand. Sawed through flesh and bone.
Indeed - I'm investigating his death and have some questions.
I told Lorgan we didn't have enough to spare all the refugees. I knew it was a bad idea.
Slowly. Lorgan was a good man, if naive. He deserved better.
Who do you think killed Father Lorgan?
Reckon so... There's something off about you, anyway. Might be brain rot.
Leave.
What do you want to know?
Now, if you'll excuse me, I've got a dead high priest to see to.
Cures of temperament are a touch beyond my skill set, I'm afraid.
I'm looking into Lorgan's death. I need to ask you some questions.
Which priest?
I've been dealing with some anger issues recently.
Looks like we're opening back up to the refugees. No rest for the wicked.
How did he die?
How did he die?
Who's the priest?
You don't seem that sad about his death.
My ear points are a bit dry right now.
Now I've got a dead priest to deal with as well.
I found a paralytic poison on one of his wounds. Lorgan was alive while they took the hand, he just couldn't scream. It's sick.

EditorData.NodeContext: she's in shock - think like a frontline doctor patching up soldiers in a triage centre

Text.Value: One of the refugees killed him. Cruelly, too - they cut off his hand, sawed right through the bone.

EditorData.NodeContext: stammer just before "I think" due to grief

Text.Value: How badly wounded was he?
I'm undergoing delayed illithid ceremorphosis.
Why are you so busy?

Synopsis:
Sister Rose tells you that Father Lorgan was found on the kitchen floor, stabbed. 
The wound wasn't that deep but it wouldn't stop bleeding and it couldn't be healed, not even by curative spells.
